website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell All Out Crush 2 GTX is a waterproof running shoe that was received well by its purchasers. Many neutral runners were happy of this trail companion’s waterproof upper, the comfortable underfoot platform, and the high-quality design. Moreover, they liked its apparently good-looking façade. On the other hand, some testers felt that the width was inconsistent.
pros: The waterproof capacity of this running shoe’s upper unit was lauded by testers
The comfort given by the midsole foam was noticeable, a purchaser observed
Several consumers stated that the general quality of the materials used for the Merrell All Out Crush 2 GTX was reliable
The aesthetics of this product were appreciated for being pleasant to the eyes
A couple of users felt that the toe box was broad enough to accommodate toe-splay
The arch was well-supported by the midsole, claimed a runner
cons: A few individuals complained that fit was a bit narrow

customer_reviews.title: Generous Sizes
customer_reviews.text: Bearing in mind that I had the hassle of sending back and reordering, I have still given the product a well deserved 5 stars. After having had the shoes for a few weeks now I am really happy with my much researched trail/running/hiking shoes. They are generously wide and also at least half a size larger than asics or puma running shoes. The main use for these will be for when I travel abroad and it is too cool/wet for trekking sandals. Really comfortable and waterproof and with good traction they are exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: MR LEOLedge

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight yet waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: I used the size estimator guide that was provided and and ended up taking a half size smaller than I normally would and it turned out to be just perfect. Shoes are waterproof yet they seem to be be reasonable enough to stop my feet from overheating. I use these for walking to and from the station everyday day on a walk that is approximately 1 hour and I have been pleasantly surprised by these Comfortable supportive and firm yet deliciously light in weight. Special points for the super grippy sole.
customer_reviews.author: Dg Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice and waterproof but difficult to remove the insole
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits ok and initial tests showed that it's indeed waterproof. However, I need to use orthopedic insoles which requires removing the existing insoles. This was very difficult because they were glued in. I have now removed most of it and otherwise I like the shoes, so I keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Florian Roßmann

customer_reviews.title: Comfort or durability - which matters most?
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't know how to rate these. On the positive side, these are without question the most comfortable training/running shoes I've ever owned. On the negative side, I have worn through the soles in less than nine months - and I'm a light user. In mileage terms we're only talking a handful of runs for a serious athlete. So, if comfort matters most to you, buy them, but if you're hard on your footwear, don't. Me? I'll buy a new pair - but strictly for use in the gym. Trouble is, that's not really the point of these shoes, is it?
customer_reviews.author: Beancounter67

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Won't give the 5 stars for the size error. Although I wish to give it back it's impossible since its already used. Amazing shoe nonetheless, only feel that there should be an easier way to send one or 2 sizes for trial and send the other back.
customer_reviews.author: G. Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Incredible fit. Solid grip. Goretex doing its job. No wet feet yet but haven't fully submerged the foot in water to know how well the shoe drains back out. Chose these over a pair of Solomon speedcross 4 GTX which were so narrow and high they made me feel like I was wearing platform's. Zero stability! The merrells in stark contrast feel like the foot equivalent of a pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof but grippy
customer_reviews.text: Good grip and lightweight which makes them great trail shoes but I thought I could use them for walking too but seen as they aren't waterproof I can't. Water seeped in through goretex membrane (not through tongue or top of shoe). Also very low cut around ankles so comfy for running but again useless for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable  and tough
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and tough . Initially I thought they were too small but they changed to fit perfectly . Used them quite a bit over the last few weeks and so far they live up to the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: Have worn Merrell trail shoes for a while and their more minimal models. I have run in these a couple of times and have enjoyed the grip and firm feel of the sole. They are light enough to wear in races and on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Steene/Emily Barratt

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Light in weight.
customer_reviews.text: Really Nice. Perfect Fit and Light in weight.. Very Comfortable.Colours are lovely . So Far so Good👍
customer_reviews.author: Miss.C

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: If you have a foot that’s as narrow as a lollipop stick, these trainers are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas webster

customer_reviews.title: Soles worn out after 4 months - awful quality
customer_reviews.text: They seem good but the soles wore out after only 4 months and are letting water in through the bottom. Please avoid.
customer_reviews.author: markfaulkneruk

customer_reviews.title: Good service great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Way cheaper than retail . Nice simple shoes that fit well and feel light . Delivery excellent
customer_reviews.author: Brian McConnell

customer_reviews.title: This is not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This product is not water proof - my feet are soaked after walking the dog through wet / damp grass in the local park. It was not even raining. Very poor return for eighty pounds
customer_reviews.author: Mark

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's All Out Crush 2 GTX Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Fast and versatile shoe with breathable waterproof technology grips, drains, and protects during the toughest of training challenges. Features: gore-tex waterproof membrane, bonded invisible fit construction for lightweight, breathable protection that fits and feels like an unprotected shoe Mesh and tpu upper traditional lace closure Lycra neoprene heel lining for comfort Integrated foot bed trail protect pad offers additional support off road M Select grip outsole tunes each outsole with durable traction that grips when and where you need it Stack height (heel/toe): 22.5/16.5 mm; foot bed: 0 mm; insole: 2 mm; midsole: 14/8 mm; sole: 1.5 mm web, 5/6.5 mm lug Vegan friendly.
feature_bullets: GORE-TEX Invisible Fit - Provides waterproof protection and breathability at a lighter weight.
TPU Overlays - Offer durability and help provide a snug fit.
Lycra Neoprene Heel Lining - Offers extreme comfort.
Trail Protect - Offers additional support off road.
